alert.note: Alert for Canon City Vicinity, Eastern Fremont County; Colorado Springs Vicinity, Southern El Paso County, Rampart Range Below 7400 Ft; Northern El Paso County, Monument Ridge, Rampart Range Below 7500 Ft; Pueblo Vicinity, Pueblo County Below 6300 Feet; Trinidad Vicinity, Western Las Animas County Below 7500 Ft; Walsenburg Vicinity, Upper Huerfano River Basin Below 7500 Ft; Western, Central Fremont County Below 8500 Ft; Wet Mountain Valley Below 8500 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Warning issued December 01 at 4:04AM MST until December 02 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 5 PM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...West winds 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 85 mph expected. * WHERE..The I-25 corridor region from Monument Hill to the New Mexico border, Fremont county and the Wet Mountain Valley. * WHEN...From 8 PM this evening to 5 PM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are expected. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...TRAVEL ON I-25 WILL BE EXTREMELY DIFFICULT TONIGHT. THE PROBABILITY OF HIGH PROFILE VEHICLES BEING BLOWN OVER WILL BE EXTREMELY HIGH. The most intense winds will occur along the I-25 corridor region from Colorado City southward to the New Mexico border, and the northern El Paso county region. Significant tree damage is likely. Do not park your vehicle under trees.
info.instruction: People should avoid being outside in forested areas and around trees and branches. If possible, remain in the lower levels of your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Use caution if you must drive.
